subject: Real Estate
title: Lehman Brothers: The Night the World Changed
description: A fast breakdown of Lehman Brothers: The Night the World Changed for builders.

hook.text: On September 15, 2008, Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy. It was the largest in U.S. history.

buildup.text: Lehman held $600 billion in assets, heavily concentrated in real estate and mortgage securities.

discovery.text: The government had bailed out Bear Stearns months earlier. Markets assumed Lehman would get the same rescue.

twist.text: Treasury Secretary Paulson let Lehman fail. The global financial system seized up within hours.

climax.text: Credit markets froze worldwide. Banks stopped lending to each other. The domino chain was unstoppable.

punchline.text: One bank's failure froze the entire world's credit.

quiz.question: Why did Lehman's failure cause global panic?
options: Markets assumed a bailout would happen
